name: educable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a person) able to be educated, or able to learn: There is still a belief that old people are not educable. In the past, these children were not considered to be educable.
(of a skill, a subject, etc.) that can be taught: The capacity to understand others is educable. Scientists have shown that this is an educable skill.
More examplesFewer examplesDo you think it's true that some people are more educable than others?We can probably assume that most patients are educable on these matters.We have a duty as a society to educate all educable children.
